screensframework

Class AddFilmPageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • screensframework.AddFilmPageController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, StaffToolbar

    public class AddFilmPageController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, ControlledScreen, StaffToolbar
    FXML Controller class for the add film page. This page allows the employee to add films using a films title, image and its brief description. Both the films title and description are entered using a textfield and textarea respectively. When the user prompts the 'upload image' button on the page, a filechooser will be prompted allowing them to select an image. The image's absolute path, title and description are then added to the database using the object class: movie and methods within the textfilemanager class. Moreover, if the add film title field matches a title in the database, the details of that film will be updated. Also, if the film image is uploaded correctly, the image will be displayed alongside the entered fields. Feedback is also provided.
    Author:
    Fraz Ahmad with additions from Mark Backhouse

      • uploadImg

        private void uploadImg(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                throws java.io.IOException
        When the 'upload image' button is pressed, this method is initialised. Opens up a window to choose an image. Specific files ending in jpeg or png can only be chosen. The pathway of the image is then stored - to then be added to the database if the user executes the add film method.
        Parameters:
        event - of 'upload image button being pressed'
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when image could not be uploaded.

      • addFilm

        private void addFilm(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
              throws org.json.JSONException,
                     java.io.IOException
        When the add film button is pressed. Allows the user to add a film to the database. A new movie class is initialised and transferred to addFilmDetails in the textfilemanager class. It also prevents against empty fields being added to the database.
        Parameters:
        event - of 'add film' button being pressed
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - - when fields are not compatible with the database.
        java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be found.
